summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that a transcript of a deposition taken on November 6, 2009, in West Palm Beach, Florida, is authentic and may be received as evidence at trial. The document is signed by the U.S. Attorney and Maxwell's defense attorneys.

events.title: Deposition in West Palm Beach
events.description: A deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this deposition is marked as document 3506-001.

events.title: Stipulation Filed in Maxwell Case
events.description: The prosecution and defense in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell file a stipulation agreeing to the authenticity of a 2009 deposition transcript for use at trial.

keyFacts: The parties in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case (S2 20 CR 330) stipulate that a transcript of a November 6, 2009, deposition is authentic.
The deposition was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida.
The authenticated transcript is intended to be received as evidence (Government Exhibit 1006) at Maxwell's trial.
The stipulation is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and Maxwell's four defense attorneys.
The document is dated November 2021, indicating pre-trial procedural activity in the lead-up to Maxwell's trial.
